I felt worse and worse, I had a bad headache, and I even had symptoms of nausea and vomiting. Friends are experiencing similar symptoms. In an emergency, we immediately sought help and called the emergency number. Rescue workers arrived at the scene and provided us with first aid. They moved us to a shady spot and provided us with cooling towels and enough water to keep us hydrated. After a period of rest and medical care, our symptoms gradually eased. Rescuers advised us to regain our strength slowly and avoid exposure to the heat. Until we're completely back to normal.

I helped her get out of the sun-soaked garden and into the shade. I offered her a glass of cold water and patted her cheek gently to help keep her awake. I called the emergency services immediately and told them about our situation. They sent an ambulance immediately. While waiting for rescuers, I continued to give her fluids and dabbed her forehead and neck with a damp towel to help lower her body temperature. They told me she had an elevated temperature, but luckily we acted in time to avoid more serious consequences.

column5: My neighbor, an elderly gentleman, enjoys being outdoors and caring for his garden. Although I repeatedly warned him to be cautious in the face of the heat wave, he always responded with optimism and said, "I have experienced hot summers when I was young, I will be fine." One day I noticed him continuing to work in the garden in the heat of midday. I was concerned that he might be affected by the heat wave, so I persuaded him to go inside and rest to avoid excessive exposure to the heat. However, he said he felt fine, just a little hot. When I got home a few hours later, I noticed that he wasn't moving around the yard as usual. I went to knock on the door, but I got no response. I was so worried that I immediately called the police and asked them to deal with the critical situation. Police and emergency services quickly arrived and entered his home. However, he had lost consciousness and was having difficulty breathing. Emergency personnel immediately began administering first aid, trying to restore his breathing and heartbeat, and rushed him to the hospital. Unfortunately, he eventually died of a heat attack. This heartbreaking incident has brought great shock and sadness to the entire community.
